title: Lead Singer of 3 Doors Down Was 47
desc: Brad Arnold, the lead singer and founding member of the American rock band 3 Doors Down, died on Saturday after a battle with cancer. He was 47.

title: Australia's men and women unbeaten in Perth Sevens to set up semifinal opportunities
desc: Australia makes a hot start to the Rugby Sevens in Perth, with both the men's and women's teams going unbeaten in securing semifinal berths.

title: As Bad Bunny plays the Super Bowl, he'll be cheered on by the Israeli-American producer on his team
desc: Yuval Chain helped create music for Latin rapper's Grammy-winning album, and has worked with stars including Drake and Post Malone

title: Ottawa gives Canada Post a $1.01-billion loan amid ongoing financial struggles
desc: The federal government says it is making more than $1 billion available to Canada Post in the form of a repayable loan to help the beleaguered Crown corporation remain solvent and keep its services running.

title: Chin steadies ship as Wexford eventually see off Carlow
desc: Wexford out-scored neighbours Carlow 1-10 to 0-02 in the closing 15 minutes to nail the third-round Allianz Hurling League Division 1B spoils at Chadwicks Wexford Park on Saturday.

title: Winter Olympics 2026: Hilary Knight ties U.S. women's ice hockey record to maintain unbeaten start
desc: Taylor Heise also impresses on her Olympic debut in comprehensive 5-0 win over Finland.

title: Everton win battle of own goals with Fulham thanks to Leno’s late blunder
desc: Bernd Leno’s own goal in the 83rd minute gave Everton a 2-1 win over Fulham after the home side has gone ahead through Vitalii Mykolenko’s own goal in the first half

title: Michael Dawson amazed by West Ham developments as Nottingham Forest fears raised
desc: West Ham moved to within three points of Nottingham Forest on Saturday, and Michael Dawson can't believe what he's seeing.

title: City of Windhoek’s response to water leak ‘poor’ say residents
desc: %%title%% %%sep%% %%primary_category%% %%sep%% %%sitename%% %%sep%% Windhoek's Donkerhoek residents awoke to find their household contents wet and damaged after a pipe burst early on Saturday morning.

title: Every word from Arteta's post-Sunderland presser
desc: The manager on the win, Gyokeres’ form, the state of play in the league and more
